headline: Global economy to struggle in 2025, US the 'bright spot': Strategist
summary: With 2025 right around the corner, Summit Place Financial Advisors founder and president Liz Miller joins Wealth! Host Brad Smith to make a case for US stocks (^DJI,^GSPC, ^IXIC). "As we look into 2025, what we're seeing is a global economy that's likely to be struggling, and the one bright spot is probably the United States," Miller says. She explains her investment strategy given her US-centric economic outlook, saying, "What we look for across the board is, certainly, domestic exposure in terms of sales versus global" as well as positive cash flow and improving leverage "with the [current] rate environment." Miller highlights Hartford Financial (HIG) and Disney (DIS) as stocks she expects to gain in 2025. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Disney, BBC partner to distribute 'Bluey' movie planned for 2027
summary: Disney (DIS) and the BBC announce they will be partnering to distribute the "Bluey" movie, produced by Australian studio Ludo. The "Bluey" movie is set to come to theaters in 2027. The "Bluey" series was the most streamed show in the US in 2024 on Disney+. Catalysts Co-hosts Seana Smith and Madison Mills break down the news and what it means for Disney. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Disney price target raised to $135 from $122 at Rosenblatt
summary: Rosenblatt raised the firm’s price target on Disney (DIS) to $135 from $122 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. The company’s “build up for growth,” explained by Disney’s CFO at a media conference last week, “looks do-able — especially given recent momentum,” the analyst tells investors in a research note. The firm says this warrants a more constructive valuation stance on the shares. A re-rating for Disney can be supported by rising confidence in the company’s portfolio durability and growth
